refsynopsisdiv.title: Syntax
refsynopsisdiv.synopsis: [r,g,b] = hsv2rgb(h,s,v) rgb = hsv2rgb(h,s,v) [r,g,b] = hsv2rgb(hsv) rgb = hsv2rgb(hsv)

listitem.para: a vector of size n. The "hue" values.
a vector of size n. The "saturation" values.
a vector of size n. The "value" values
a n x 3 matrix. Each row contains a [hue saturation value] triple.
a column vector of size n. The associated "red" values.
a column vector of size n. The associated "green" values.
a column vector of size n. The associated "blue" values.
a n x 3 matrix. Each row contains a [red green blue] triple.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: The function hsv2rgb converts colormaps between the RGB and HSV color spaces. As hue varies from 0 to 1.0, the corresponding colors vary from red through yellow, green, cyan, blue, magenta, and back to red, so that there are actually red values both at 0 and 1.0. As saturation varies from 0 to 1.0, the corresponding colors (hues) vary from unsaturated (shades of gray) to fully saturated (no white component). As value, or brightness, varies from 0 to 1.0, the corresponding colors become increasingly brighter.
